para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:9px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: ) will contain references to other packages in the

. Such references will be to class names, globals etc. The packages upon which a particular package depends are known as its prerequisite packages. Whenever you try to install a package into your image the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: first tries to ensure that all of the prerequisites are already present. Sometimes, if the prerequisite packages are not yet installed, the Package Manager will attempt to load them for you. Note that, if for some reason some of the prerequisites cannot be loaded, it will not be possible the complete the installation of the dependent package.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: In some situations, it is possible to end up with a situation where you have a circular sequence of prerequisite packages. Strictly speaking this is an invalid state and Dolphin will prevent you from saving out any packages while they are in this condition.
